_header: He that will with the devil eat / A long spoon must he get
_description:
A proverbial couplet (Tilley (1950)
XTilley, Morris Palmer. A Dictionary of the Proverbs in England in the 16th and 17th Centuries. Ann Arbor, MI: University of Michigan, 1950, S 771)

BLHar2321.Transcription: He hath need of a long spoone þat eatith with þe deuill
BLHar2321.Note: Added to right margin by a later hand.
BLHar2321.Editions:
Wright,  Thomas,  and  James Orchard Halliwell-Phillipps, eds.  
             Reliquiae Antiquae.
         2 vols. London: Smith, 1845: 1.208.

BLSl747.Editions:
Förster,  Max. 
             “Die heilige Sativola oder Sidwell.” 
             Anglia
         62 (1938): 33-80: 203.
